title: Korean Immigrant Wins Seat in Canada's Lower House
text:
Canadian opposition Conservative Party candidate Nelly Shin has been elected to the House of Commons, becoming the first Korean-Canadian woman to do so.

Shin, 47, won a Lower House seat in Monday's federal election.

Shin captured 16,588 votes -- or 31.3 percent -- in the Port Moody-Coquitlam constituency of British Columbia, 333 more than rival candidate Bonita Zarrillo.

According to local media, Shin's family moved to Canada from Korea in 1977 when she was 5 years old.

She studied at the University of Toronto and later taught music at a high school and worked as a Christian missionary, before getting into politics in order to help people in need.
description: Korean Immigrant Wins Seat in Canada's Lower House
